parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To release on receipt of ransom; mid: I redeem, release by paying ransom, liberate. From lutron; to ransom.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Lawlessness, iniquity, disobedience, sin. From anomos; illegality, i.e. Violation of law or wickedness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: Apparently a primary word; a people.
From the present participle feminine of a compound of peri and eimi; being beyond usual, i.e. Special.
One who is eagerly devoted to a person or a thing, a zealot. From zeloo; a 'zealot'.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
